      • resourceId

        public OddRequest.Builder resourceId(java.lang.String resourceId)

        Allows Builder to tell which resource id to request

        Requires resourceType to be present

        Ex. resourceId("12345") https://base.url/resourceType/12345

        Parameters:
        resourceId -

        • the OddResource ID

      • relationshipName

        public OddRequest.Builder relationshipName(java.lang.String relationshipName)

        Allows Builder to tell when to request a resource's relationship resources

        Requires resourceType and resourceId to be present.

        Ex. relationshipName("videos") https://base.url/resourceType/resourceId/relationships/videos

        Parameters:
        relationshipName -

        • the relationship name

      • include

        public OddRequest.Builder include(java.lang.String include)

        Used to specify which relationships' resources you want to include in the response. The relationship must exist.

        For best results, use sparingly. This can drastically increase response sizes if a relationship's data set is large.

        When present will enable 'include' query parameter.

        Ex: include("relationship,relationship2") https://base.url/resourceType/resourceId?include=relationship,relationship2

        This is only applied to single-resource response types (non-list)

        Parameters:
        include -

        • comma separated list of relationship names to include with request

      • account

        public OddRequest.Builder account(android.accounts.Account account)

        Used to specify the OddViewer Account which contains an Authorization JWT.

        This can be overridden by authorizationJWT

        Parameters:
        account -

        • the android Account to use for authorizing the request.

      • authorizationJWT

        public OddRequest.Builder authorizationJWT(java.lang.String authorizationJWT)

        Overrides the default Authorization JWT. This should be overridden for all non-config requests.

        Defaults to the token specified in Oddworks.CONFIG_JWT_KEY in the application meta data.

        Parameters:
        authorizationJWT -

        • the JWT you wish to specify

      • versionName

        public OddRequest.Builder versionName(java.lang.String versionName)

        Overrides the default versionName of the application, taken from the applications package info.

        This is only used in the x-odd-user-agent header used by metric events service.

        Parameters:
        versionName -

        • the version name you wish to specify

      • apiBaseURL

        public OddRequest.Builder apiBaseURL(java.lang.String apiBaseURL)

        Overrides the default base URL of the Oddworks instance where requests will be sent.

        The default is set in Oddworks.API_BASE_URL_KEY in the application meta data.

        If not set there, a fallback of Oddworks.DEFAULT_API_BASE_URL is used.

        This is usually not necessary to override.

        Parameters:
        apiBaseURL -

        • the base URL for your Oddworks instance

      • acceptLanguage

        public OddRequest.Builder acceptLanguage(java.lang.String acceptLanguage)

        Overrides the default Accept-Language header.

        Defaults to a combination of Locale default language and country.

        Parameters:
        acceptLanguage -

        • the accept language header value

        See Also:
        Locale

      • limit

        public OddRequest.Builder limit(int limit)

        Limits the number of results from a multi-resource (list) request.

        Ex. limit(5) https://base.url/resourceType?page\[limit\]=5

        Parameters:
        limit -

        • the number of resources to return

      • offset

        public OddRequest.Builder offset(int offset)

        Offset the result set in a multi-resource (list) request.

        Ex. offset(10) https://base.url/resourceType?page\[offset\]=10

        Parameters:
        offset -

        • the number of resources to offset

      • sort

        public OddRequest.Builder sort(java.lang.String sort)

        Sort the result set in a multi-resource (list) request.

        Use this to specify the property used to sort the result set with a single property using dot notation.

        Ex. sort("meta.source") https://base.url/resourceType?sort=meta.source

        Parameters:
        sort -

        • the property to use to sort the result set

      • query

        public OddRequest.Builder query(java.lang.String query)

        Specifies the search query.

        Ex. query("the term") https://base.url/search?q=the%20term

        Parameters:
        query -

        • the search term

      • event

        public OddRequest.Builder event(OddMetric event)

        Specifies the class OddMetric event to POST.

        Required when resourceType is OddResourceType.EVENT

        Parameters:
        event -

        • the event metric

        See Also:
        class OddMetric

      • login

        public OddRequest.Builder login(java.lang.String email,
                                java.lang.String password)

        Specifies the class OddAuthentication resource to POST.

        Required when resourceType is OddResourceType.VIEWER

        Parameters:
        email -

        • the email address

        password -

        • the password

        See Also:
        class OddAuthentication

      • addResourceToWatchlist

        public OddRequest.Builder addResourceToWatchlist(java.lang.String viewerId,
                                                 OddResource resource)

        Specifies the class OddResource to POST to the given class OddViewer's watchlist relationship.

        Parameters:
        viewerId -

        • specifies the id of the OddViewer

        resource -

        • specifies the resource to add to the watchlist

        See Also:
        class OddResource, class OddViewer

      • removeResourceFromWatchlist

        public OddRequest.Builder removeResourceFromWatchlist(java.lang.String viewerId,
                                                      OddResource resource)

        Specifies the class OddResource to DELETE from the given class OddViewer's watchlist relationship.

        Parameters:
        viewerId -

        • specifies the id of the OddViewer

        resource -

        • specifies the resource to remove from the watchlist

        See Also:
        class OddResource, class OddViewer

      • recordProgress

        public OddRequest.Builder recordProgress(java.lang.String videoId,
                                         int position,
                                         boolean complete)

        Records the class OddProgress which updates the class OddViewer's progress for a given OddVideo

        Parameters:
        videoId -

        • the id of the OddVideo

        position -

        • the position within the video

        complete -

        • whether or not the viewer has completed the video

        See Also:
        class OddProgress, class OddViewer, OddVideo

      • skipCache

        public OddRequest.Builder skipCache(boolean skipCache)

        Force OkHttp to hit Oddworks API instead of relying on cache.

        Defaults to true

        Certain endpoints are not cacheable. Also, see OddRequest.MAX_CACHE_SIZE

        Parameters:
        skipCache -

        • whether to skip cache and hit API

        public OddRequest build()
